resources.string: Mind your cuttables out there, friend. Apparently, some mysterious treasure washed ashore, and now the place is overrun with pirates on the hunt for gold!
Welcome to the gem of the south, traveler… <g id="litearmor_converseleft" />the Cutlass Keys. If you’re keen to stand a while and listen, I keep a tip or two for every new visitor!
Welcome to Cutlass
The ever magnanimous Patricia Reid wishes to welcome you to Spyglass Ridge and Cutlass Keys. Do her a favor, and speak to some of her friends, will ya?
“Spyglass has a town greeter?”

Something <g id="litearmor_chuckle" priority="high />like that… name’s Pat, and I make it a point to know everyone in town. <g id="litearmor_youknow" />Like to keep my finger on the pulse of the place, you see?
"I can understand that."
It pays, too. Information is as good as cold, hard coin around here, <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />and there's no shortage of that either. If you're looking for work, you won't have to look hard.
Matter of fact… and this is the only free tip I'll give you… I know of at least two parties looking to hire out for someone <g id="litearmor_converseright" />bold enough to venture into the jungle.
“Fair enough, point the way.”
One has a tale to tell. <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />A cautionary one, to be sure, but he's also offering rewards if you're willing to stick your neck out. His name’s Grimm.
And then there's Oxen. <g id="litearmor_handheart" />Lost his entire crew to some horror they stumbled into out there. A foul affair, but he's also paying, if you'll get him some revenge.
"I'll speak with them both."
That’s the spirit! <g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />Come see me when you’re done, and if you plan on ranging far from town, be wary. It’s a lawless land out there, friend or foe is a grey line.
Grimm and Oxen, they're both characters, alright.

Well,<g id="litearmor_agree1" /> I hope you made out well in your dealings with Grimm and Oxen. Your name's been coming up in a lot of conversations around here. I might even have something else for you.
"Another tip?"
Those doubloons you've got, you can trade 'em in for loot from Grimm's old hauls. <g id="litearmor_gesturebackthere" />At the well over there. Go check it out.
Those doubloons are worth more than you realize. Throw some in the old well down the way and make a wish... they don't call it the Well of Fortune for nothing!
That table has treasure aplenty, <g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />and I've no doubt you'll be coveting the lot. Get out there and bring back a haul of doubloons.
“Where should I search?”
Well… <g id="litearmor_youknow" />if you're comfortable taking bounties, you'll find them aplenty down south, but be careful, you may earn a bounty yourself.
Speak with James Oxen in the Tavern
Speak with First Mate Grimm in the Tavern
Speak with Patricia Reid
Investigate the Well of Fortune
And then there's Antonia Lucian, our intrepid magistrate, she's offering doubloons for anyone who can assist in her affairs.
"What's going on southwest?"
Whole region's madness. Everyone at war with everyone, no matter your flag. Be warned, you'll have to defend yourself against other adventurers there.
Be warned friend. Careless adventurers lost to the gold curse tell no tales. Best keep your ruddy hands safe indoors, until you harden that hull of yours. Ha!
That look in your eye… no accident coming to me, was it? Other folk in these parts don't believe my tale, but you might just be the one I've been looking for.
Pirate's Life For Me
First Mate Grimm waits eagerly in the tavern to tell the tale of the cursed doubloons to any and all newcomers. Hear his words and listen well.
"Tell me your tale, then."
Well, not so much a tale as a nightmare. Those doubloons that everyone's after... nobody knows the power they hold. The madness they inflict…
Sit down already, we’re in a damned tavern! Rest your legs and feel the fire. You don’t always need to be in such a rush… This won’t take long.
Now, listen and listen well. Those doubloons are mine by right, and I aim to destroy the lot! I brought the curse here, and I aim to rectify that.
"Noble purpose for a pirate."
Noble? No. Penance... for crimes I can't undo. But you don't work for free, do you? Don't worry, I'll make it worth your while. I have treasure. A lot of it.
Noble? No. Penance... for crimes I can't undo. But you don't work for free, do you? Don't worry, there's treasure to be had. The Well of Fortune will see to that!
Wealth from several lifetimes of adventure upon these shores. Equipment, armaments, reagents... all of a quality you have yet to behold. So what do you say?
Gather the doubloons and offer them to the Well of Fortune. Your reward? Equipment, Armaments, Reagents... all of a quality you have yet to behold.
"Sounds good to me."
Very well, then. Should we succeed, you'll have brought some measure of peace to an old freebooter and enriched yourself in the process.
Much of the Esperanza's gold washed up on the southwest islands. But be warned, those cursed doubloons invite mayhem. Watch your back.
Take a Seat and Listen to Grimm's Pirate Tale
Speak with First Mate Grimm
Remember, every cursed doubloon you find must come to me to be destroyed. Do not tarry with them in your possession, lest ye find yourself caught by the curse.
Remember, every doubloon you find must be offered to the Well of Fortune. Do not tarry with them in your possession, lest ye find yourself caught by the curse.
You should not idle long in these lands. An encroaching darkness continues to spill over from the Elysian Wilds… I fear it cannot be contained.
Black… the waves were black and the sky was red. <g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />Johnson was up in the crow’s nest. They came from the shore. Those horrid buzzing wings. I heard him screaming.
My crew are back to their old freebooting ways, thanks to you. Aye, you've got the gratitude of this old pirate, whatever that's worth.
It Crawls Beneath Us
James Oxen is seeking a cure for the curse that turned his crew to stone. Speak to Glendyn Trahern in southeastern Cutlass Keys for answers.
"What happened?"
We found Medusa, <g id="litearmor_hopeless" />but she was not alone! Her ravenous brood ripped my crew to pieces. The lucky ones were turned to stone. I- I jumped ship and swam to shore…
The remains of my crew <g id="litearmor_lookdownguilty" />are at the docks. I abandoned them... their own captain! The druid, Trahern, is looking after 'em now. I'm too ashamed to show my face…
"I'll go check on them."
Aye. <g id="litearmor_crossarmsupset" />Thank you, friend… I'll be here drinking my sorrows. If you can find a cure for those that survived, I'll be forever in your debt.
The carnage... <g id="litearmor_worry" />there's not enough ale in this tavern to wash away what these eyes have seen…
Greetings, old friend. You must have spoken with Oxen, if you came looking for me here. I'm afraid the captain's story is true... Medusa has returned.
Follow Oxen's Directions southeast to Gorgon's Landing
I can only hope that with your aid, Trahern and the druids can find a way to contain that serpentine hag once and for all!
Blasted Admiral Blackpowder, blasted crew--blast them all!
You there! Aye, you! Heard the twisted tale of Admiral Blackpowder? Abused me sorely, he did, but I'll have the last laugh. Here, come closer, come closer…
Admiral Blackpowder's Fall (Expedition)
Enter the Barnacles and Black Powder Expedition. Gather the chronicles of the infamous Admiral Blackpowder, and take him down for Wally Widdershins.
"I think I'm close enough."
Hah! Caught your ear, though, didn't I? Same as the Admiral, feeding us golden lies about mysterious treasure on a magic island.
I smelled a rat, but did anyone believe ole Widdershins? Poor sods. Now they're all Lost, and the Admiral…
"Worse than Lost?"
Worse, far worse. When we first landed on this godforsaken shore, the Admiral found something.
An ugly little idol, what turned him into something even uglier. He's a beast now, but even so, I say he can't suffer enough for what he did to us. You in?
Blackpowder... cruelest man in all the seas, and crueler still with that idol. Soon as you've stamped him into the ground, I'm walking the straight and narrow.
Hah! I heard them cannons roaring! You gave ole Blackpowder a taste of his own medicine, eh? No less than the bastard deserved.
As for me, my piracy days are over. Maybe I'll take up the fishing pole again…
I can't believe you listened to me, but I'm right glad you did, friend.
All our suffering wasn't for naught, and you gave the Admiral a sound drumming. It's never a good day round here, but today… today's not bad.
The sea near Aeternum churns like a massive cauldron, like nothing I've ever seen. It sounds fanciful, but I've heard tales of a city beneath the rolling depth.
The sea near Aeternum churns like a massive cauldron, like nothing I've ever seen. It sounds fanciful, but I've heard tales of a city beneath the rolling depth.
Mysteries of the Deep (Expedition)
Enter the Barnacles and Black Powder Expedition to disrupt the work of a suspected Water Elemental for Rowan Pennbrook.
"That's intriguing."

Can you imagine? A whole region of Aeternum under water. Of course I can't prove it, but... I did track a Water Elemental to this very lair. Hopefully those pirate fools haven't reached the Elemental's sanctum, though I suspect it is very deep within the caverns.
Hopefully those pirate fools haven't reached the Elemental's sanctum, though I suspect it is very deep within the caverns.
"I'm heading in and could check."

Hmph. I'm not as young as I once was. I've got my pride, but you have a point. Watch yourself. This Water Elemental is composed of pure magic and power, and I wager it won't be friendly. If you manage to defeat it, hurry back and tell me!
Watch yourself. This Water Elemental is composed of pure magic and power, and I wager it won't be friendly. If you manage to defeat it, hurry back and tell me!
In my heyday, I hunted all kinds of Elementals across Aeternum. Ha, just talking about it gets my blood pumping!

You say she was called a 'Nereid?' Fascinating, fascinating! Even if this Nereid said nothing about an underwater city, she must have come from somewhere, and come here for some purpose. Now to find out what it was…
Even if this Nereid said nothing about an underwater city, she must have come from somewhere, and come here for some purpose. Now to find out what it was…
A domain of hidden secrets… there must be some truth to the stories. With the Nereid defeated, perhaps there's a way into the Great Beyond beneath the waters.
Treasure, trinkets, gold and glimmer… Make my coin purse shine and shimmer!
Treasure, trinkets, gold and glimmer… make my coin purse shine and shimmer! Across the water, buried deep, all for the taking… mine to keep!
Cleansing Treasure (Expedition)
Enter the Barnacles and Black Powder Expedition to collect golden trinkets from the crewmembers. Bring them back to Quiggley Quorus to cleanse and sell them.
"Did you say… treasure?"
Aye. I was a holy man once upon a time, but no more, no more. Poverty and celibacy? What a terrible bore!
I stole away with Holy Water, and the magistrate's only daughter. Now I'm here true and bold, ready to cleanse what can be sold!
"You mean the cursed treasure?"
Of course, of course, you silly horse! Blackpowder's got riches untold, the sort I'd claim, ere I'm old. Bring the pretties to me, and a proper reward you'll see!
I've nothing but holy water and wits! You'll fight and bring me the baubles and bits!
I've a buyer in mind, but first I must pay you in kind. Take your reward, take your coin, and hurry back for more to purloin!
Useful, useful, yes you were. And so bold! Many a bauble have I, ready to be sold. Come back soon young scallywag, and I'll have more loot for you to bag.
Arnold Trost at your service. I used to be the sailing master on the Vernal Bounty, keeping watch against storms. These days I prefer to stay indoors.
All this excitement has gotten the Lost a little too riled up for my taste. Thankfully, I've got this here "Lost Deterrence" concoction to ward them off!
Smell the Future
Arnold Trost has discovered Lost are repulsed by man-sized sticks of burning incense. Venture into The Salty Marshes and light a Lost Deterrence Pylon to keep them out of Spyglass Ridge.
"How does it work?"
It's pure incense, according to Fei, if you can imagine that. I don't think anyone expected those waterlogged corpses to be mindful of strong smells.
Fei could explain the science of it, I'm more concerned with results. We chased them back to the swamp, but we'll see more Lost if we aren’t proactive.
"Is there more to do?"
Why, yes! We plant pylons in the swamp wherever Lost congregate. If we prevent them forming groups, they're less likely to approach Spyglass Ridge.
"I can do that."
Good for us, friend! Take these with you and light 'em in the swamp. Be mindful of the Lost, these things drive them mad.
Every minute you delay the Lost get more organized.
Oh my... I don't know what's worse. The Lost or the smell of that incense... I guess it beats being overrun and beaten to death by a horde of withered ghouls…
Travel to {POITags}
Light and defend the Deterrence Pylon
Light and defend the Deterrence Pylon
Light and defend the Deterrence Pylon
Defend the Lost Deterrence Pylon
Whew! That is quite an odor coming off the pylon. Pungent, to say the least... I almost feel bad for using it on those decaying bastards, but it does the job.
"It definitely does… something."
It surely does. We should light more! Keeping pressure on the Lost will ensure they stay busy knocking down incense instead of our doors.
The more ground we cover, the further away we'll push the Lost out from our settlements. Find a good spot and get to it.
I know it's it's dirty work, but it must be done. Get out to the swamp and place more pylons as soon as you can.
Good work there, friend. I can smell those pylons from here... unfortunately. A job well done, though, nevertheless.
Another batch planted? Good. We're all a little safer.
To think I once hunted many of the scoundrels here. Now they’re my brothers and sisters in this nightmarish land. What a twist of fate.
The Sable Fleet are a ruthless bunch. They’ve captured many fortune-seeking pirates flocking south towards newfound treasures.
I’ve been informed that the Sable Fleet have already amassed new prisoners. They're potential allies in our cause. We can’t let them rot in those cages.
Don’t stray too far. The way things are goin' down here, those prison cells won't be empty for long!
With tales of treasure afoot down south, I highly doubt these are the last of the Sable Fleet prisoners.
Keys to Freedom

Spymaster Bronn wants you to cause a distraction in Pirate's Stand by unleashing the encaged Ancient Guardians upon their jailers. With the enemy occupied, find the prison key and release the pirate captives to bolster our ranks.
"What makes them ruthless?"
They turn their captives into new crew members. I’ll spare you the grim details of that process. If we save 'em, they'll be in our debt. That's what matters.
They're in a prison south of here. The Sable Fleet somehow outwitted the Ancient Guardians that inhabited those ruins and transformed it into their stronghold.
"I’ll get them out."
Glad to hear it! Say though, you might want to create a distraction to keep the Sable Fleet occupied while you free all the prisoners. That's what I'd do.
Be careful, I don’t want to see you in one of those cages. We’re running thin as it is.
A rough lot you saved. We’ll have to vet them before offering our supplies and arms, but I have a feelin' they'll prove their worth. Good work.
Travel to {POITags}
Search for the prison key
Unleash the encaged Ancients
Release the Captives in Sable Prison
Open the Southern Prison Cell
Open the Center Prison Cell
Open the Northern Prison Cell
"I'll free them."
Those Sable Fleet bastards are on high alert since your raid. They also managed to capture even more prisoners. We'll need to break them out.
"I'll rescue them."
Aye, I trust you know your way around the battlefield. Now, let's break those prisoners free before the Sable Fleet have their way with them!
I hope you get to the captives before the Sable Fleet enact their judgement. We don’t need even more soulless pirates wandering Cutlass Keys.
These scallywags look even worse than the last bunch, but they'll increase our strength in numbers, and we should be on the lookout for more in the future.
Don’t stray too far. With tales of treasure afoot down south, I highly doubt the prison cells will be empty for long.
A Shocking Revelation
Help Billiam Rowen with the discovery of his lifetime by defeating the Spectral Tyrant and ridding his cave of Lost! Return to Billiam in Cutlass Keys when you've finished.
No.. No, no, Orion shouldn’t be there, it can’t be there! It’s supposed to be over there! This is incredible, I’ve never seen anything like this.
Oh, I do apologize friend. The heavens entrance me you see, so my eyes are usually pointed up, not down. Name’s Billiam, though most call me "Wistful Bill."
That spirit you brought down must’ve lived up to the tales. Its power is immense in even small doses, though I fear I’m getting carried away with my usage.
"See anything interesting?"
Ah, yes! I’ve been charting the skies above Aeternum for years now and stumbled across quite the revelation. Perhaps you’d like to sit down before I tell you.
The sky moves! No, really, it does. Constellations are popping up where they have no business doing so. See for yourself; look at my charts!
How can you be sure?
Well, I can’t, not yet at least. I need two things to confirm my discovery: a significant power boost and a confined space to conduct my studies.
I found the perfect cave near Fort Ramos, but a Lost brute forced me out. I even caught a glimpse of an astonishingly powerful spirit in the woods nearby!
Rumor has it there’s a trick to summoning that particular spirit, something about 3 pillars and beams and… It’s all a bit beyond me, I’m afraid.
I would handle this myself but… Well, my talents lay in more academic matters. How would you like to assist me in the most important discovery in Aeternum?
Oh, how I long for the sea at times… But the skies are a rather compelling alternative. I do hope you’re faring well with my request friend!
I can’t thank you enough. As long as those Lost stay away, I can confirm my research and seal our names in the history books of this great island!
Ah, there’s my fellow star-gazer! You won't believe this, but I'm right back in the same jam I was before! Don't suppose you'd be willing to help?
"Sure. I'll go back in."
Maybe we'll get lucky and that fiend won't be there… maybe. I can't tell how important this is for me to continue my studies.
The night sky is like a vast sea, with constellations as its beautiful creatures. I wonder if I’ll ever come across a manatee star pattern…?
A Spectral Tyrant
Travel to the Spectral Forest
Activate the Summoning Pillars
Destroy the Spectral Skull
Kill the Spectral Tyrant
A Slice of a View
Travel to the Cave of Tithing
Supercharge Billiam's Telescope
Complete Event "Slicing for a View"
A Spectral Tyrant
Destroy the Spectral Skull in Quest "A Shocking Revelation"
Kill the Scourge of the Storm
Slicing for a View
Charge the Telescope in Quest "A Shocking Revelation"
Slay the {targetName}
If you think being marooned on Aeternum is a curse, beware the bane surrounding the treasures of Cutlass Keys.
This is all of it, right? And then… and then you’ll leave me in peace?
You’ve been of great help. It’s time to see if the voice will be satisfied with all the recovered artifacts.
Stay safe out there. These are dark times to be wandering Cutlass Keys without a trustworthy crew.
Whispers of Wealth

A collector named Edwin Kasper is haunted by a voice that demands the recovery of artifacts lost among the shipwrecks of Cutlass Keys. Search for a golden beam to the south west and return the artifacts to satisfy the mysterious voice and save Kasper's sanity.
“Who are you talking to?”
Please, help me. I hear a voice… it hungers for artifacts that it once possessed.
It's this relic I obtained not long ago. Ever since I found it, I'm hearing this voice commanding me to recover its lost possessions.
"What can I do to help?"
Just make it… no! Just do what it says! It whispers about a golden beam to the south that shines into the sea of stars. That is where you’ll find the items it seeks. Please, help me!
I wish I never found this cursed relic. It's sheer torture what it's putting me through.
You found them! Surely, surely this is enough to appease it. I hope… at least. Thank you, friend.
Complete the Quest Encounter "Endless Riches"\n(Search for the golden beam surrounding the marked location to find encounter)
Collect Spectral Artifacts
Endless Riches
A mysterious chest calls to you. The treasure inside is yours to claim… if you dare to open it.
Stage 1/3
Open the Chest
Stage 2/3
Defeat the Spectral Pirates
Defeat the Treasure Wraith
Stage 3/3
Curse is lifting
Open the Chest
Might I trouble you again? The voice claims that only a few more artifacts remain. With those returned, I will be free today… I know it.
"Alright. I'll find them."
You’ve been a boon in this wretched situation. Find the golden beam to the south as before. That should lead you to the artifacts.
I pray this is the last of it. I can’t take much more…
These must be the last pieces. It has to be. Thank you for not running off with such valuables. Your honor in a land of thieves is to be commended.
It’s time to find out if the intruder in my mind is satisfied with the artifacts you recovered. I should hear a verdict shortly.
I'm Rosina, I used to be the coxswain on a pirate ship called the Fair Weather Friend. You could say I know a thing or two about enduring hostile environments.
After the Touched Coin fiasco, I started looking into rumors myself instead of leaving things to chance. Have you heard what they say about The Bloody Spike?
Soul Trap

Rosina Bryce's search for supernatural rumors have led her to The Bloody Spike. Defeat warriors living and dead to collect enough Soul Gems for an offering, and see fortune bestowed by The Bloody Spike.
"Can't say I have."
Legend has it living and Lost are both naturally drawn to this spire, and the bloodshed surrounding it hardens the soul into gemstones at the moment of death.
Warriors are claiming the gems and offering them to The Bloody Spike itself. They claim it brings them "great fortune."
"Have you seen it happen?"
No, and that's where you come in. You don't have to slay the living… unless you want to, of course. Just strike down enough to see what's what, and then return.
"I will test this legend."
Do this, and I'll ensure you receive the "great fortune" as promised! Well, a pretty good fortune anyway. A decent fortune at least.
Defeat Warriors around The Bloody Spike
Travel to The Bloody Spike
Collect {itemName}s from Warrior Spirits or Players
Collect {itemName}s from Players
Offer Soul Gems to The Bloody Spike
You won't find any gemstones standing around, I'd get moving if I were you.
So the legends are true? The Bloody Spike was feeding off your actions, wasn't it? And you return with the gemstones to boot… well done.
Here because you want to pay The Bloody Spike another visit?
"That's how it seems."
What do you say we extend our previous deal? Bring us more gems and I'll ensure you find even more fortune.
I wouldn't keep The Spike waiting.
The Bloody Spike's hunger waxes and wanes, we need not gorge it. The time will come again soon enough.
The Bloody Spike and I are pleased, we hope to see you again soon.
Ah, you’re a new face ‘round here! Name’s Decima Opimius, pleasure to meet ya! Can I interest you in any of my delectable recipes?
By chance, are you heading to the Citadel? If so, I’ve become rather well known for cooking up some damn good grub that’s sure to light a fire in your soul.
As harrowing as your last tale was, I can't help but wonder if you have more to tell. Who knows, another story might spark some inspiration for new dishes!
Good to see you again! You know, your story really only whets my appetite. It inspires my cooking, no doubt, but I must admit I long for another tale soon.
For Guts and Glory
Get your hands dirty and defeat other fighters at the Citadel. Return to Decima Opimius when you have a story worth telling.
"Oh, have you?"
Sure have. I can crack a few skulls, sure, but fighting’s not really for me. A spatula’s a bit more my speed. If you’re heading to the Citadel, best prepare!
"Why is that?"
I've filled the bellies of many fine warriors, and few among them would step one foot into the Citadel. I'd be careful around that place if I were you.
Rumor has it the island was once considered sovereign land and all who stayed there were equals. No laws, just honor among thieves keeping things civil.
"That couldn't have lasted."
Well, yes. If the rumors are true, you may be right. I’d go and see for myself, but then who’d keep this lot of ruffians from tearing each other apart?
If you do go to the Citadel, and live to tell the tale, come and tell it to me! It’d mean a great deal, and I can even reward ya if the story is good enough.
Oh, come now, your stories aren’t nearly good enough to earn your reward yet. Get back to the Citadel and stand your ground!
That… Well, goodness! That might actually keep me up at night. I wouldn't have thought you could be so vicious. Hope I never disappoint you with my meals!
"I could go for a fight."
That's the spirit! Get back down to the Citadel and get your hands dirty. I'll get mine dirty too, just with flour... not blood.
A dash of cinnamon and perhaps some smoked paprika… Are you allergic to anything? Just trying to make you something special for when you get back.
Are you determined to keep me up at night?! That was disgusting. Well, I suppose I did ask for it, and I hate to admit you've left me wanting even more!
A Hard-Fought Victory
Travel to the Citadel
Enter the Citadel Fighting Pits
Complete Event "A Hard-Fought Victory"
Kill Players in the Citadel
A Hard Fought Victory
Enter the Citadel in Quest "For Guts and Glory"
Kill the Scourge of the Storm
Hi, I'm Plute Swampy! I used to be the cook aboard the Salty Albatross. Ah, those were the days! We might not have been the best pirate crew, but we sure had fun.
What'll it be, friend? A stiff drink to keep the horrors at bay? Or perhaps a hearty meal to reassure yourself you ain't Lost?
Them crafty little thieves! They stole more pots and pans from me reserve.
I tell you, it's a relief to have my pots and pans back. They were seasoned to perfection from years upon the sea.
Out of the Frying Pan
Return the set of pots and pans to Cook Swampy in the Cutlass Keys Settlement.
"What would you recommend?"
Normally I'd recommend the Cutlass Quiche. But can you believe it, there are some around here who don't appreciate my cooking! My cooking!
I usually make it a habit to shrug off such nonsense, but not this time.
"Why not?"
Because those tasteless thieves stole my pots and pans! My father gave me that set, and it was gifted to him by his father before him!
Last I saw, the thieves were headed west into the marsh.
Have you recovered me pots and pans yet? I once used that frying pan to hit a patron who didn’t pay up. He doesn’t remember it, probably from the concussion.
Ah, let's see… that's them! No better pans in all Aeternum! Oh, I can kiss ya.
"Glad I could help."
Thank you! I'll have to cook up something special just for you! Maybe I'll make one of Shillie's favorites.
Travel to {POITags} to find Swampy's Pots and Pans
Collect {itemName} from Lost Pistoleers or Lost Blunderbuss
Collect {itemName} from Hungry Streaked Alligators
Collect Swampy's Stockpot from the Pirate Leader atop the fort
Collect {itemName} from a chest in Spire Rock Fort
"I’ll get them back."
It’s probably the same delinquents from Spire Rock Fort. I admire their taste in cookware, but those are family heirlooms.
Any luck finding my pots and pans? I can’t believe they found my secret compartment under the rug. Uh oh…
You brought my pans! Thanks again. I'll cook you up an old Swampy special... on the house of course!
No chance anyone’s stealing my precious pots and pans ever again. I made sure to lock’em up tight this time. But if they get lucky, I know who to send their way.
Shillie Duffy here, quartermaster of this settlement. We all hailed from different vessels when we arrived on these shores, but we formed a new crew.
No one is going to recognize this as a pirate town without any plunder. Where's the gold, silks, and chests overflowing with purloined booty?
In Search of Plunder
Explore Ancient ruins to collect artifacts. Search chests to collect Heron's notes. Talk to Quartermaster Duffy in the Cutlass Keys Settlement when your task is complete.
"I see your point."
Word is the Ancient ruins might have some good ol' fashioned plunder in them. A man by the name of Heron came through town a while back, saying as much.
But then we never saw nor heard from Heron again. If you venture out there, I'd reckon there's a good chance the plunder's still there.
"Worth investigating, at least."
If we're lucky, you'll find more than just artifacts. Mr. Heron might have left notes we could use to search for more profitable artifacts in the future.
All that plunder isn't going to go fall into our laps without some effort! Explore the ruins and bring back what artifacts you find.
Now, that's a sight to behold! Look at all of this beautiful plunder. This is exactly the type of booty a pirate town needs!
And Heron's notes… hmm, nothing here with clues to more loot. Just a record of his research... probably not worth much. You keep them!
Travel to {POITags} to search for artifacts
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}s
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Relics of the Tower
Loot relics from chests inside Crow's Nest Lighthouse. Talk to Quartermaster Duffy in the Cutlass Keys Settlement when your task is complete.
Spyglass Ridge is finally starting to prosper, but we've still got a lot to do if we want to show those layabouts in Moonbay what a real pirate town looks like.
"What else needs to be done?"
Well for starters, you can find some more of those artifacts. I bartered the last batch for more than its weight in gold!
I've heard whispers of some peculiar relics stashed in Crow's Nest Lighthouse. They'd fetch a handsome price, but be on your guard: the spire is treacherous.
It's not as fun as plundering another ship at sea, but raiding ruins is still quite lucrative. And you don't get seasick, neither!
Magnificent! What unusual artifacts. I'm sure we will have no trouble finding a buyer. I dare say a return to the spire for more may be in order!
Search Chests for Ancient Relics
I should’ve listened when Swampy first mentioned missing supplies. I've been blind. I kept thinking it was the other pirates, when in truth it was my old crew.
Welcome, friend! Fancy another trip to Malocchio Spire? We can always use more artifacts to shill... I mean, sell!
"There's still more loot to find?"
But of course! There's always loot to be found if one looks in the right place, and Malocchio Spire is surely the right place!
Ahoy! Do you have the booty?
Your plundering has brought welcome disrepute to our fine, pirate town! Well done!
Best let those pirates cool down for a bit. Wouldn't want them to migrate their smuggling grounds.
Welcome to Cutlass Keys. I am Antonia Cassia Lucian, captain of this settlement. It was my crew that first established this place when we shipwrecked years ago.
Explosive Prospecting
Investigate the source of the tremors in the Highpass Mining Camp and defuse the situation. Talk to Captain Lucian in Spyglass Ridge when the task is complete.
Ever since those cursed doubloons washed ashore, Cutlass Keys has been a magnet for Lost pirates. If we don't do something soon, we'll be overrun!
"What can I do to help?"
There's an old mining camp in Pirate's Pass. A band of Lost pirates recently laid claim to it and I fear they may be up to something sinister.
Tremors have been felt near the mine in recent days. Strong tremors. We need to put a stop to the explosions before the hillside comes down around our ears!
What we don't need is a landslide ruining our fine settlement. Investigate the mining camp and put a stop to their plans.
We'll all sleep safer at night without those explosions rattling the cupboards, but I fear the pirates may soon return.
"I'll be here if they do."
Thank you, friend. I knew we could count on you for your help.
Travel to Highpass Mining Camp to investigate the tremors.
Collect Black Powder from {targetName}s
Collect Fuses from {targetName}s
The tremors have resumed with greater force and frequency than before. I feared this might happen.
We've been noticing some slight seismic activity again…
"Shall I return to the mine?"
If you would be so kind. We would prefer to keep the mountain, and our town for that matter, intact.
Show those Lost brigands that we will not stand idly by while they threaten our town.
That should deter those greedy bastards for some time. Thanks.
The hills sound quiet for now… I'll flag you down if and when they starting acting up again.
Welcome! I'm Fei Lixin, artificer exraordinare. I like to keep up on all the latest crafting advancements. Let me know if you need anything made special.
Lightning in a Bottle
Find elemental materials from spirits and bring them back to Artificer Fei in the Cutlass Keys Settlement.
I have been studying the Lost for quite some time now and I believe that I may be on the verge of an extraordinary breakthrough that could change everything!
“What kind of breakthrough?”
You have no doubt seen the numerous specters and phantasms that wander among the Lost. Some of these spirits even display strange elemental properties.
My theory is that if a phantom survives too long without a physical body, it must draw upon the elements to continue to exist. The elemental essence is the key!
"The key to what, exactly?"
The key to everything! Don't you see? Help me. If we harvest the elemental essence from the phantoms, we can turn it against them. Against the rest of the Lost!
"Let's do it."
Travel to the Spectral Forest and bring back as much elemental essence as you can gather from the spirits there. I will wait here for your return.
We have to find a better way to fight back against the Lost. Perhaps the bottled lightning is the edge we need.
Ah, yes. These will do nicely! Give me some time to prepare the device, and when you return we will begin the next phase of our work!
Travel to the haunted Spectral Forest
Collect Water Spirit Essence from {targetName}s
Collect Lightning Spirit Essence from {targetName}s
This collection station doesn't seem to be set up yet.
This drop-box was set up by Fei-Lixin, and there appears to be a work order posted.
"What is the request?"
The work order is requesting the necessary resources for more bottled lightning. Bring the resources, take a doubloon. Honor system of course.
The box sits, silent, waiting for goods.
No doubt Fei Lixin is grateful, and you're now a bit richer.
The box appears full. Come back later.
Lightning Unleashed
Place the Lightning Jars in locations around Fort Barnacles. Talk to Artificer Fei in the Cutlass Keys Settlement when the task is complete.
You've returned! Impeccable timing, I must say. Thanks to your help in gathering the elemental essences, I have just completed several new prototype devices!
"What do the devices do?"
I'm glad you asked! Thanks to your combat prowess and my ingenuity, we have literally captured lightning in a bottle. The Lost are about to get quite a shock!
"What do I do with them?"
Simply place the lightning bottles in areas occupied by the Lost. When enough Lost have gathered near the bottle, it will erupt with electrifying vigor!
I recently heard that Fort Barnacles has been overrun by a band of Lost pirates. A pity to be sure, but it should act as an ideal testing ground.
Those jars aren't going to test themselves. They need to be around a high concentration of Lost.
Well? Did the lightning traps perform according to expectations? I do hope it was an electrifying experience!
"You should make more of these."
I plan on it! We'll need every possible trick to hold back the Lost. Something is changing their old habits, so any new advantage we can gain will help.
"Have you made improvements?"
Several, actually. Mostly minor tweaks, but enough to warrant further testing. Head back to Fort Barnacles and deploy them in the same way as before!
Ah, excellent work as always! But innovation requires iteration, as they say, so please return soon for the next round of testing.
Place Lightning Jars
Those lightning bombs are sure to help hold off the Lost the next time they try to take over our fort!
Well, if it isn't my electrifying companion! How about another round of testing? I've already prepared the next batch of lightning bottles.
My work has never progressed this steadily. The data you collected has been invaluable, friend. All these new developments may just warrant another test soon!
The animals on Aeternum are magnificent! Such power, such strength! Oh, I'm Tosch the Tamer, and I'm certain there is a trick to taming the animals on Aeternum.
Aeternum has a strange effect on animals. Even pets that arrive here soon turn feral. I've come here in search of answers. Would you be willing to help?
I have heard tales of a savage beast in Cutlass Keys. The locals fear the animal so much that they refuse to travel near its lair, even during the day.
I would like to learn more of the wildcat population here in Cutlass Keys. I know it's not easy work, but I'll need more materials from the local felines.
Now that I know the secret to taming animals on Aeternum, the time has come to find the perfect pet! It must be stalwart, but beautiful. Smart, yet obedient…
Ah, isn't a boar just the perfect pet? It eats almost anything. And if it reverts to being wild, well, you've got yourself a meal!
Animal Instincts
Gather samples from wildcats and alligators and bring them to Tosch in Cutlass Keys so he can study how to tame them.
"What can I do?"
I'm an animal empath. I can intuit their thoughts and feelings. But sometimes I need more... sometimes I need parts of the animals to understand them.
It is for a good cause, I assure you. I'd like to study the wildcats and alligators here more closely, if you can bring me some scales and claws, that is.
Nature is beautiful, and can be distracting, but you need to stay focused. Remember the goal - seek out wildcats and alligators!
These are perfect. Can you imagine having a tame wildcat helping you hunt? Or an alligator keeping the Lost away from your home?
"We can do that?"
Not yet, but soon. Imagine an entire army of alligators rising up against those loathsome Lost and driving them out to sea!
Gather samples from wildcats and alligators and bring them back to this collecting station.
"What does the note say?"
I’m so glad you found one of my collecting stations! Since you’re here, why not help me out a trifle? I am in need of both wildcat claws and alligator scales.
Nature is beautiful, and can be distracting, but you need to stay focused. This collecting station won't fill itself!
Tosch is sure to find these samples useful, just as he's sure to not miss this doubloon he so graciously left lying here.
Collect Sharpened Wildcat Claws from Island Bobcats
A station left to collect animal scraps, though it isn't of any use just yet.
This collecting station has a signed note on it from Tosch the Tamer.
Snaggletooth
Collect a tooth from a fierce lion and bring it to Tosch in Cutlass Keys.
"What is this beast?"
A lion named Snaggletooth. Seek out his den and return with his legendary fangs. Soon we will be one step closer to taming these magnificent beasts.
Hunt him down and bring me back his famed snaggletooth. Then I may be able to understand how he commands such respect from the other lions.
To catch a lion you need to emulate it - be courageous and boldly go forth to seek it out!
This is a very large fang, even among adult lions. I will take some time to study it closely. In the meantime, I have news regarding your previous task.
It seems the cycle of death and reanimation on Aeternum is affecting the animals. Each time one dies, it comes back with increased aggression.
"That is an interesting theory."
Indeed. I will need more time to prove it, of course. In the meantime, I have another task for you.
Collect a tooth from the one and only Snaggletooth and bring it back to the box for Tosch.
"What does the note say?"
Excellent work, locating another of my collecting stations! I could do with more Snaggleteeth, drop one off here and take some coin for your trouble.
This station is filled with animal parts, it would be best to wait for Tosch to gather them and refill the stash of coins.
It would be much simpler to take the reward left here by Tosch, but something resembling a conscience is keeping you from this act of blatant thievery.
You drop a tooth into the box and hear it clatter against numerous other teeth. It sounds distressingly similar to the coin you drop in your purse.
A station left by Tosch the Tamer to collect animal scraps, though there's no instructions attached.
This collecting station has a signed note on it from Tosch the Tamer.
Catnipping
Gather whiskers from island pumas and bring them to Tosch in Cutlass Keys.
"What do you need?"
I've had trouble communicating with the native pumas. If you bring me some of their whiskers, I might be able to attune myself to their thoughts and feelings.
"How will I find them?"
I've had trouble communicating with the native pumas. If you bring me some of their whiskers, I might be able to attune myself to their thoughts and feelings.
Now is no time to behave like a cat! You need to get out there and collect some whiskers from the island pumas!
These whiskers should do nicely. I can already feel myself connecting with the spirits of the pumas. I feel we're making progress, but something is yet missing.
"What is missing?"
I wish I knew. I still need more time to attune to the animals. Return to me later and perhaps I will have the answers we seek.
Gather whiskers from island pumas and bring them back to this collecting station.
"What does the note say?"
Good on you, finding my collecting station! Had to hide it so bandits stopped stealing from it. I could use more island puma whiskers, for a reward of course.
This station is still empty and sad, bring back some puma whiskers to make it filled and glad!
"How many whiskers can one man need?" The question plagues your mind as you set them in the designated basket.
A station left to collect animal scraps, though it isn't of any use just yet.
This collecting station has a signed note on it from Tosch the Tamer.
Taming the Lionhearted
Gather collars and leashes from tamed dogs and bring them to Tosch in Cutlass Keys.
You may find this difficult to believe, but there is a group on Aeternum who have successfully managed to tame wild animals.
"What group?"
Lost Pirates! Have you seen the guard dogs they keep at Fort Barnacles? I must have you investigate and report back. There's so much we can learn from them!
"What should I look for?"
The Lost must have a method for controlling their animal companions. Bring back any leashes and collars that you find. There's a chance they may be enchanted.
I'd stay away from the Lost too - but those at Fort Barnacles have the knowledge I seek! I must have those collars and leashes!
Hmm... I do sense powerful magic within these restraints. Something dark... almost... sinister.
"They should be destroyed."
Agreed. I will dispose of the items after thoroughly studying them. Perhaps, given enough time, I can design something better.
Gather collars and leashes from Lost Pirates and bring them back to the box for Tosch.
"What does the note say?"
This is bittersweet, you've found the last of my collecting stations! Gather more of those evil harnesses and bring them here so I may destroy them.
This station is filled with collars and leashes, it would be best to wait for Tosch to gather them and refill the stash of coins.
Standing before Tosch's final collecting station makes your heart hurt. You steel yourself before the work ahead.
You stuff the leather straps into the box with some effort. All that work deserves a reward, and Tosch has graciously provided.
A station left by Tosch the Tamer to collect animal scraps. There's a page titled 'Work Order', but is otherwise blank.
This collecting station has a signed note on it from Tosch the Tamer.
Perfect Companion
Gather boar bristles and bring them to Tosch in Cutlass Keys so he may tame the ultimate pet!
"I don't need the entire list."
I shall cut to the chase then. It's a boar! I simply must tame a wild boar. I just need you to slay a few of them first and bring me their bristles.
It's the only way I can be sure I'm right, and if you do it, I'll reward you handsomely!
Please find some boar bristles so I can be sure I want one as a pet.
Just feeling these delicate bristles between my fingers brings me a sense of profound joy. I am confident that a boar is the right choice.
"I'm glad you're happy."
I'll be truly happy once we bring pets to Aeternum for all to enjoy! When that day finally comes, all of this work will have been more than worth the effort.
"Again with the list..."
Ah, I was so lost in thought I didn't see you there! I’ve been using boar’s hair wherever I can, embracing the essence of boar. Could you get more for me?
Lining clothes, stuffing pillows, knitting blankets, I'm keeping very busy. I'll let you know when I need more boar bristles!
You don't want to hear another boar pun do you? I promise it won't be pretty! Get going before I think up another ab-boar-rent joke!
My joy in receiving these boar bristles has yet to diminish, nor has my gratitude to you for delivering them to me!
A station left by Tosch the Tamer to collect animal scraps.
Gather boar bristles for Tosch and bring them back here.
Hey, want to find your way around the swamp? You can't go wrong by talking to me, Swamp Walker Nekumanesh, fresh back from Restless Shore.
I never thought I'd say this, but it's just too quiet around here, you know? I never noticed the silence while my wife was still around, but now it's deafening.
A Disturbing Silence
Search for Jocelyn at Castaway's Colony. Talk to Swamp Walker Nekumanesh in Cutlass Keys when the task is complete.
"What happened to your wife?"
We had an argument. She wasn't happy with my being away so often for work. Said she was going to find somewhere else to live... that was some time ago.
Last I heard, Jocelyn had made her way out to Castaway Colony. But nobody has seen or heard from her since. Will you help me find her?
Chatting with you is filling the silence, but I long to hear my wife's voice again. Seek Jocelyn out at Castaway Colony.
There were no signs of Jocelyn? I was certain she'd be there... multiple people from town saw her heading up there.
"No one was there but the Lost."
She always did like chatting to the Lost. Said they were better listeners than her own husband. Maybe she eventually moved on to somewhere else…
Travel to {POITags} to find Jocelyn
Search for Jocelyn within the colony
I've been thinking about where Jocelyn might have gone. She had some relatives nearby. Strange folks that kept to themselves, but she'd often visit them anyway.
Tracking by Teeth
Track Jocelyn by finding her teeth in River's Crossing. Talk to Swamp Walker Nekumanesh in Cutlass Keys when the task is complete.
"Where do they live?"
They're from River's Crossing. You'll find it just to the west. I'm certain that she must be over there right now, just chatting away with her kinfolk.
"What makes you so sure?"
Well, she loved talking. She jawed on so much that her teeth started to fall out! She's there all right, talking away. Just look for a woman with missing teeth.
If only I hadn't gone to help map the swamps in Reekwater. Have you found my wife, or her teeth? River's Crossing is a good place to start looking.
So, this is all you could find? No signs of Jocelyn? These teeth are unmistakable, definitely hers... where did you find them? All in one place?
"Scattered throughout the area."
I see. Maybe they were keeping her teeth in case she returned for them. She must have moved on once again. I'm sure we'll find her if we keep looking!
Ask residents of River's Crossing about Jocelyn
Defeat Jocelyn's Lost relatives
Gather {itemName} from chests at River's Crossing
I realize that you already looked for Jocelyn at River's Crossing, but maybe you just missed her. Would you be so kind as to check back there once more for her?
Heart of the Marsh
Find Jocelyn and recover a keepsake from her. Talk to Swamp Walker Nekumanesh in Cutlass Keys when the task is complete.
"What could I have missed?"
I do recall someone telling me that they found Jocelyn's trunk and many of her belongings in the marsh near the fishery. She must be there after all!
Go on, she doesn't bite, at least, not anymore without her teeth. You'll find Jocelyn at River's Crossing.
What's this? Jocelyn's diary? It looks thick enough to be a memoir! Did she give you the diary to bring back to me?
"She... wanted you to have it."
I see. Perhaps she'll be willing to talk once I read the diary. This could take years though... the writing is so small and difficult to read!
Ah Jocelyn, where did we go wrong? At least I have her lengthy diary to remember her by. It will take me a lifetime to read it all!
Discover what happened to Jocelyn
Recover {itemName} from {targetName}
Hi, hi there! I'm Claire, Claire Fergus. I've read all about Cutlass Keys! It's said to be filled with pirate treasure; you just have to know how to find it.
You’ll remember the name Claire Fergus as the best treasure hunter in all of Cutlass Keys! I just need to, ya know, actually find some treasure first.
Treasure Island
Follow the treasure map Claire provided to discover great riches! Talk to Claire Fergus in Cutlass Keys when the task is done.
"Do you have a map?"
Yes! But that’s where my problems begin; it’s only half a map, unfortunately. It points directly to the Cursed Steps, but I can’t seem to find anything there!
"Mind if I take a look?"
Be my guest. The map belonged to one Thompson the Tireless who is said to have been so good at hiding riches, his crew couldn’t even find it with a map.
This is all a bit exciting, isn’t it? I just wish my last partner hadn’t stolen the other half of the map. At least this half has the ‘x’ that marks the spot!
That’s it, just a handful of doubloons?! Where's the rest of the treasure? Where are the gems, the piles of gold, the chests of riches I was promised?
"That's all I could find."
Curses! My old partner must have beaten us to the punch and used the other half of the map to plunder the treasure! We should search the area again to be sure.
Explore the Cursed Steps in search of treasure
Collect Silver Doubloons from chests in Cursed Steps
Unbelievable… Simply unbelievable. That just can’t be all that was left. We may need to search those ruins again soon; I refuse to give up that easily.
"Is there even anything left?"
There must be! I refuse to believe that traitor I once called a partner was able to best me in my treasure hunt. Get back out there and find whatever you can!
Look, I'm flattered, but what are you doing coming back here and talkin' my ear off? It's not a courtship I'm looking for, it's treasure!
By the Kracken, is that really all that was left? This really is looking dire… Maybe if we wait a bit longer, something will turn up?
I've been thinking, why don't we take another stab at the Cursed Steps? I'm sure it would be no trouble to venture through again, what with your reputation.
Much of the suffering in this settlement is brought on by the foolish actions of those who settled here.
Much of the suffering in this settlement is brought on by the foolish actions of those who settled here.
You have so much more inside than you know, Marauder.
A curious bunch, you erudites.
Ah, I am Alchemist Edwarde Geoff. The legacy of the Ancients has never been closer, but only we of the Syndicate are positioned to take it in our grasp.
I have been studying the ruins and am working to harness the power of Azoth within them. Perhaps you will help.
You profiteers let your greed for gold distract you from the real fortune of Aeturnum.
I'll grant that you acolytes live a noble life. Ignorant and blind, perhaps pointless, even. Yet noble.
You must fight to survive here. There are frequent attacks from the Corrupted and a never-ending supply of pirates out to steal our supplies.
So many heads to bash, so little time. Stop wasting my time and go out there and stake a claim for yourself.
You only have the leisure to study because we Marauders spill our blood.
You cultists always seem scarce when the Corrupted are at our gates.
I will… I will… yes, yes! I promise! Please stranger, just leave me be. I am talking to… someone else.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} enemies
Collect {itemName} from the {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from a {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from an {targetName}
Gather {itemName} from chests at {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from a chest at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}s
Artemis's foul creation, the reborn Medusa, has taken refuge here, recreating the primordial beings Echidna and Typhon. This is a legend in the making.
Much stands between you and the threat of the Broodmother Medusa. I trust you will go forth and conquer the challenges before you.
I knew you had the strength to overcome the challenges before you. The Broodmother Medusa will not be able to withstand the might of your party.
Perseus
Ancient Hero

string.comment: Subtitles Only No VO Alien voice like Caretaker
string.speaker: Echidna

resources.string: What is this…. new body? Such power...! Mmm. I can smell you, human. I will consecrate the soil with your blood.

string.comment: Subtitles Only No VO Alien voice like Caretaker
string.speaker: Echidna

resources.string: Typhon!... Avenge me my love!

string.comment: Subtitles Only No VO Alien voice like Caretaker
string.speaker: Typhon

resources.string: Flesh? Sweet Flesh..... plump piggy flesh..... Feast! Teeth will tear. Pigs will bleed.... FEEAASST!!
The heroes charge in yet again. You humans never quit. But my brood will claim Aeternum and exterminate your kind. All will bow to the mother.
The heroes lay crumpled, pathetic and twitching. Spread your wings, my children, fly forth upon the lands beyond.
You fools. You scorch the earth and defile nature's destiny. My children may not fly today... but we will return.
She can create Primordial beings?
Yes, it is a twisted form of the earth's natrual magics. She believes she is setting the world to right. But her path will only end in tears.
<font color="#7a63d4">Can we use such power against her?</font>
If you mean to create your own Hercyne to battle hers…. You begin to worry me friend. I implore you to banish such thoughts from your mind.
<font color="#2cd834">I've defeated worse.</font>
I admire the bravado, friend! Haha, one day you might be as storied a hero as I - if you keep your wits about you.
<font color="#fde63a">What unholy means of creation...</font>
Indeed, the Herceryne are ravenous beings. Twisted abominations of the earth's good soil. I sense a spark in you, I believe you are the one to end this.
How did you overcome Medusa?
Not without aid. I used the mirror shield of Athena, hid from her gaze, and decapitated her with a swift strike, but that won't suffice here. You will need allies.
<font color="#7a63d4">If we could harness her powers…</font>
No! When the history books are written of this day, do not let their quills remember you a villain as well. The ends do not justify the means, my friend.
<font color="#2cd834">Heads will roll!!!</font>
There's the flame of tenacity! A lion in man's skin. Soon they will sing your praises with mead in hand. But do not let your confidence be your downfall.
<font color="#fde63a">It is my honor to serve.</font>
A hero so humble. A rare sight indeed. Pray to whatever god you believe in, and victory will be yours.
How much further to her lair?
The Broodmother Medusa lays in wait just beyond. Prepare your tinctures and equip your best blades. Victory awaits.
<font color="#7a63d4">How exactly does her spawning work?</font>
Cruely. Painfully. And without mercy…. I see the design of darkness in your eyes, friend. Do not let it consume you like it did poor Odysseus.
<font color="#2cd834">Her black blood will rain.</font>
You are fearsome, I admire the fire in your heart. Keep a clear head and you will soon have glory.
<font color="#fde63a">For the meek. She will be defeated.</font>
Devotion to the weak. Very noble a cause my friend. Go forth and free this land from her twisted maw.
I fear we shall find no respite. As long as Medusa still roams this land, nature will not be appeased.
No doubt you've seen the remains of poor Oxen's crew. I don't blame him for fleeing. Had he not, he would share their fate.
"How can we help them?"
Just the attitude Nature needs from the Hero of Aeternum! There's an antidote I can brew. The ingredients can be found in the Hive beyond.
"I'll retrieve them."
Be wary, they say Medusa has impregnated herself, and is breeding a new army of Hercyne aberrations within the hive…. I shiver to think of it.
"I'll stop this madness."
I admire your bravado. But even if we succeed, her defeat is only the beginning. Unless we return Nature to rest, the fruit of her womb will stalk these lands for eternity.
"Nature will flourish again."
Search within and bring the ingredients. If I can learn what foul magic birthed such horrors into our world, perhaps I can devise a way to extinguish them.
Make haste! The longer we dally, the more of her brood will spill forth to contaminate this land!
You have my thanks, hero. I only pray that I have the knowledge and intellect necessary to decipher the mysteries of our forebearers.
It doesn’t look like much, but the secret to returning the spirits of the Angry Earth to their proper repose may be locked within these very eggs.
Collect Antidote Ingredients
Enter the Hive of Gorgons
Collect Hyacinth Flowers from Echoing Vale
Collect Kithos Blossom from the Baths
Collect Gorgon's Bane from The Precipice
Flesh From Stone (Expedition)
You've done well for the land and its people, my friend. Nature sends her thanks. The flowers bloom a little brighter because of you.
The Broodmother Medusa has turned Oxen's crew to stone and is spawning hordes of Hercyne to claim Aeternum. Gather ingredients for the antidote and defeat her.
Ah, you look like you could use a rest.
The guard gives you a severe glare and without a word, hands you a note.
What does the note say?
The Note Reads: If you value your tongue, you'd do well to keep your grubby hands off, unless you have doubloons. Trust me, it's no idle threat.
Enter the Barnacles and Black Powder Expedition
Collect the Lore Note titled 'The Darkheart's Roster'
Collect the Lore Note titled 'Admiral's Manifesto'
Collect the Lore Note titled 'Widdershins' Stupidity'
Defeat Admiral Blackpowder
Enter the Barnacles and Black Powder Expedition
Defeat the Nereid
Enter the Barnacles and Black Powder Expedition
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Defeat Admiral Blackpowder
Search {itemName}
Search {itemName}
Investigate the top of Malocchio
Travel to {POITags} to place Lightning Bombs at the fort
Place Lightning Bombs
Travel to {POITags} to collect a tooth from Snaggletooth
Travel to {POITags} to collect whiskers from Island Pumas
Collect {itemName} from Island Pumas
Travel to {POITags} to gather collars and leashes from the Corrupted
Travel to {POITags} to find boar bristles
Eh? Can't talk now. After you've dealt with that lot.

Yer wasting time, chasing that treasure! It's cursed, though Blackpowder and his crew won't let it go. He blames that watery wench, says SHE cursed it. \n\nMe? I say he can't tell his face from his own arse.
Leave me be. Can you not see the Lost running amok?

Didn't expect to find another living soul in here. Did She call to you? I saw Her radiance in my dreams, and I had to come. Now I can immortalize her in verse, without those reeking pirates trying to break down her door.
"Tell me about the curse."
Don't believe me, do you? No, poor Antonio, no one listens to his tall tales. \n\nMock me if it pleases you. But I wouldn't touch a coin of that treasure, not unless yer keen on eternal suffering.
"Tell me about the watery wench."

Blackpowder called her something funny. Think, Antonio…Nerry? Nerry-id? Anyhow, he hates her something fierce, has most of his crew battering at her door. If yer fool enough to go after her, you'll have to get through HIM first.
"What are you doing here?"
Heh heh…eyes on the prize, young'un. Eyes on the prize. If anyone breaks that curse, I'll be out of here with as much gold as these old arms can carry.
"Had any luck opening the door?"
Alas, no. My lady wants something, but no matter what I present to the door in offering, it refuses to budge. Perhaps I'm unworthy of such a wondrous creature…
